entry.title: Accelerate Business Value with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
In today’s digital economy, data is no longer just an IT concern—it’s the foundation of every business decision. Organizations that can unify, govern, and activate their data are the ones best positioned to innovate, adapt, and grow.

SAP Business Data Cloud makes this possible. It connects SAP and third-party data in a single, governed fabric, applying principles like zero-copy sharing and data mesh to ensure clean, trusted, and AI-ready data at scale.

To help you unlock this value faster, we’re launching a new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI): SAP Business Data Cloud Core Skills

This multi-day, expert-led workshop equips your team with the skills and knowledge they need to start strong, accelerate adoption, and deliver business value from day one.

Why it matters

With SAP Business Data Cloud, you can:

  • Unify SAP and non-SAP data into a trusted foundation for analytics
  • Apply Intelligent Applications and Data Products to deliver outcomes faster
  • Simplify integration, including SAP Databricks connectivity
  • Future-proof your landscape with a roadmap designed for AI-driven insights

By the end of the workshop, your team will be able to confidently apply SAP Business Data Cloud to modernize analytics, reduce deployment time, and maximize return on your data investments.

Who should join 

This workshop is designed for all professionals responsible for shaping, integrating, and analyzing enterprise data, including business users, IT professionals, architects, and others.

What will you achieve

By participating, you will:

  • Understand business value – Learn how SAP Business Data Cloud extends SAP BW, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Master key capabilities – Learn Intelligent Applications, Data Products, and governance best practices
  • Accelerate solution delivery – Apply Intelligent Applications for faster results
  • Integrate with ease – Connect SAP and non-SAP data, including SAP Databricks
  • Be future-ready – Gain insights into the solution roadmap and adoption path
  • Hands-on Practice – Get the opportunity to practice what you are learning in your own tenant with direct support from our SAP experts

Workshop details 

  • Format: Multi-day remote workshop, led by SAP experts and offered in multiple languages
  • Seats: Limited to 30 participants per session

👉 Register here to secure your spot and explore the complete SAP Business Data Cloud enablement portfolio.

entry.title: Re: Purpose of "authorized to teach"
entry.content: Adding on this, when you open the Instructors tab for an item, you can assign Authorized Instructors. You’ll also see the option “Check Instructor Authorization.” If this option is selected, then when you schedule a class for that item, only the authorized instructors will be available for selection. This ensures that only approved instructors can teach that class.

entry.title: Re: PS: CJE0 object value not the same with CJI3
entry.content:
Why CJE0 and CJI3 shows different values is because

CJE0 often displays amounts in Controlling Area Currency (CAC) when the report is configured to show "Object Currency"; but in reality, it pulls from the CO totals table, which defaults to CAC if no specific object currency is maintained.

CJI3, on the other hand, reads directly from line item tables and reflects the actual Object Currency (OC) assigned to the cost object (e.g., WBS element or internal order).

So even though both reports say "Object Currency," they may be referencing different sources — one from totals (CJE0) and one from actuals (CJI3).

To answer your question, "Can it be change to get value from OC? How to make it?", the answer is YES but with some conditions.

  • In CJE0, go to the report definition and check the currency settings. If the report is set to use Controlling Area Currency, change it to Object Currency explicitly. However, SAP may still interpret "Object Currency" as CAC if the object doesn’t have a distinct currency maintained.
  • For WBS elements or internal orders, ensure the object currency is explicitly set in the master data. This is only possible if Controlling Area Currency = Company Code Currency — otherwise, SAP restricts object currency assignment.
  • If consistent object currency reporting is critical, rely on CJI3 or CJI5, which pull directly from line items and reflect actual transaction currency.

In short,

entry.title: Re: CO Production Order Issue in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Unfortunately, CO production orders are not supported in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This is because the cloud version emphasizes standardized processes and restricts certain classic functionalities — including CO production orders, which are typically used for simple internal production without full PP integration.

Some viable options depending on your customer's needs:

Use PP Production Orders via Scope Item 3F0. Even if the customer does not currently have PP, they can activate scope item 3F0 – Event-Based Production Accounting, which enables production order processing in the cloud. This includes Production order creation, Goods issue and receipt, Event-based WIP and variance postings. This is the recommended approach for proper WIP tracking and production accounting in the cloud.

Manual Production Orders (Without PP Master Data). SAP allows creation of manual production orders without reference to material master or BOM/routing. This is useful for Rework orders, Setup or maintenance work, Urgent customer-specific production. You will need to manually enter material, quantity, and dates — but it’s a flexible workaround.

entry.title: Re: create custom tab with Custom Controller in Business...
entry.content:
What is happening in your case is the table TBZ3A_TD controls screen sequence assignments for Business Partner roles. If your custom tab is linked to screen 7001, it’s likely being overridden or ignored due to default screen control logic. SAP standard often uses screen numbers in the 1000–1999 or 5000–5999 range for custom enhancements. The 7000 series is typically reserved or used internally, which can cause issues like dumps or data not populating.

To fix this and get your custom controller working properly, go to SE80 or SE51 to create a new screen (e.g., 5100) and assign your custom controller logic to this screen.

Go to transaction BDT_MAINT or BDT setup transactions like:

  • BUS3 – Business Partner screen sequence
  • BUS4 – Screen groups
  • BUS5 – Sections

Assign your new screen (e.g., 5100) to the appropriate screen group and section. Make sure the screen sequence includes your new screen and is active for the BP role you're working with.

Since you already reduced the height from 27 to 14 which is a good move, still, make sure the screen layout (dynpro) matches the height and doesn’t overflow, or SAP will throw a dump. But I guess, your issue is with first two points above.

entry.title: Re: Block - Back Date Invoicing
entry.content:
Hello @Manisajnani 

You’re right that there’s no single switch to prevent back-dated billing in Public Cloud. The supported options are:

  • Cloud BAdI: Implement the BAdI for Preliminary Billing Document to verify the billing date and generate an error if it is set earlier than today. This method is the standard approach to prevent backdating.”
  • Period control and validation options include closing earlier posting periods or utilising Manage Substitution/Validation Rules to prevent accounting postings with a past date.

For details, see the available billing BAdIs here:
 SAP Help – BAdIs for Sales Billing Public Cloud 2508

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Why Can a Contract with Blocked Status in the Source List Still Be Used as a Source?
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a question regarding the process of creating a Purchase Contract and Source List, and assigning a source to a Purchase Requisition.

As I understand, in the Source List for a material, the source can be either a Purchase Info Record or a Purchase Contract.
In my case, I created three Purchase Contracts for the same material and assigned all of them as sources in the Source List.
Then, I set one contract to Fixed, and the other two to Blocked status.

I expected that only the contract marked as Fixed would be assigned as the source in the Purchase Requisition.
However, I found that the Blocked contracts were also selectable as sources, and even Purchase Orders were created successfully based on them.

Could someone explain what functional role these status values actually play?
Or is there a setting in CBC or elsewhere that I might have missed?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: B1if - Scenario Step Test Not Working
entry.content:
Hi,

If your question is still valid then:

  1. Use Record Inbound message in Maintenance Cfg Dev Env to catch inbound message from Event Sender. It's easier then creating it by yourself. Then you will see it in the list "Test inbound Message".
  2. Result button shows you the result of the scenario step - it means that this the result of xsl transformation in atom0.xsl.
  3. If you want to debug the process then use Debug button. To see all messages created during the process you have to enable logs in xcellerator.cfg - at the end of the file change logs to CONFIG.

What we now want to automatically achive is that all Group Member of the synced entraIDGroup assigned to the localIasGroup. We have already follow Note: https://me.sap.com/notes/2984603/E & Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/group-assignments-based-on-user-attributes-a-flexible-solution-for-managing/ba-p/13570696 but we dont get it worked. Our Transformation in the target system look like this:

{
    "user": {
        "condition": "($.emails EMPTY false) && ($.userName EMPTY false) && isValidEmail($.emails[0].value)",
        "mappings": [
            {
                "condition": "($.groups[?(@.value == 'entraIDGroup')].value EMPTY false)",
                "constant": "localIasGroup",
                "targetPath": "$.groups[0].value"
            },
...

I would be grateful if someone could help us find the error.

Rgs

entry.title: Re: Why Can a Contract with Blocked Status in the Source...
entry.content:
To your question "Why Blocked Contracts Are Still Selectable", it typically happens due to one of the following:

  • In SAP S/4HANA, the source list must be activated at the plant level in the material master (Purchasing view). If not activated, the system may ignore the source list entirely and allow manual selection of any valid source.
  • If you're creating POs manually (not via PR or MRP), SAP allows you to select any valid contract — even if it’s blocked in the source list. The block only affects automatic source determination, not manual entry unless additional controls are in place.
  • If the blocked entries have overlapping validity or are not properly delimited, the system may still consider them as valid. Check the valid-from and valid-to dates in the source list carefully.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content: Thank you all for your responses. I’ve identified the issue — a custom entity had been developed for RAP and exposed as an alias. However, the manifest.json file for the pages was referencing the actual entity name instead of the alias. After updating it to use the alias, everything is working perfectly now. I really appreciate your time and support!.

entry.title: Re: Need Best Practices of ABAP Access to Production Envi...
entry.content: In addition to implementing the SAP Security Baseline Template (Note 2253549) as already suggested, I recommend enforcing role-based access controls, restricting ABAP access in production, and leveraging SAP GRC tools for access governance. Tools like SAP EarlyWatch Alert, Security Audit Log, and System Recommendations should be used to monitor and validate system integrity. These measures align with SAP’s own standards and global audit frameworks, ensuring the system remains a reliable source for financial reporting.

entry.title: Re: Production Process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
If I understand your requirement correctly, you want to disassemble product R100 and take parts R01, R102, and R103 into your stock, correct?

You might consider using by-product for this process. By-products are entered as a negative quantity in the production order. Depending on your specific scenario you can use a top material with a BOM in a regular production order. Or you can create a production order without material via the app 'Production Order without Material - Create' (trx. CO07).

You can search the SAP community for multiple examples.

entry.title: Re: Total Response Time for Odata request
entry.content:
Hello team,

The total Response Time is shown in the Execution view, where there is a Response Time (ms) column (see attached screenshot for your reference).

Besides this indicator there is no other field showing overall execution data, it is divided in drill down view.  

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-focused-run/expert-portal/rum-user-interface.html?anchorId=section_1105284476

entry.title: SAP Activate Methodology for SAP Business Data Cloud - New Roadmap Release in SAP Roadmap Viewer
entry.content:
SAP has announced SAP Business Data Cloud as part of the event "SAP Business Unleashed" in February this year. 

“SAP Business Data Cloud unleashes the full value of enterprise data for Business AI,” said SAP CEO Christian Klein. “Every company on the planet wants to get more value out of their data and greater returns on their AI investments,” said Ali Ghodsi, Co-founder and CEO of Databricks. “By joining forces with SAP, we’re helping organizations bring together all their data — regardless of format or where it lives". 

SAP Business Data Cloud was released with controlled availability on February 13, 2025 and is has now been generally available since April. A great FAQ blog was created in March: SAP Business Data Cloud FAQ. 

We are now excited to announce that the implementation roadmap for SAP Business Data Cloud is now available in SAP Roadmap Viewer: SAP Activate Methodology for SAP Business Data Cloud.

Its content covers all SAP Activate phases of an SAP Business Data Cloud implementation project from DISCOVER to RUN:

  • Licensing model and licensing SAP Business Data Cloud.
  • How to request free discovery workshops and assessments for SAP Business Data Cloud.
  • The provisioning process for SAP Business Data Cloud and its core components.
  • Access to learning and onboarding sources.
  • How to connect the solution to its core components and data sources .
  • General project management tasks like Organizational Change Management, End-User enablement and execution and monitoring of an SAP implementation project.

What are SAP Activate Roadmaps in general? They provide:

  • A clear sequence of tasks to follow to implement a specific SAP solution
  • Helpful guidance and best practices for system provisioning
  • Links to key accelerators, tools, and resources
  • A smooth handover from request to configuration and readiness for project work.

Have a look at the existing SAP Activate roadmaps in SAP Roadmap Viewer: https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer:

How to provide feedback: 

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com.
  3. Leave us your comments in the section below.

Thank you for reading!

Ariane

entry.title: Now Available: Earn Your SAP Central Business Configuration Badge!
entry.content:
We're excited to announce that you can now earn a badge for completing the Configuring SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with SAP Central Business Configuration course. This course was previously available as a learning journey but has now been transformed into a standalone course, bringing a major added benefit: a badge that verifies your knowledge and expertise.

Course landing page

The course is designed to guide you through the entire process of using SAP Central Business Configuration from end to end. Just like before, the course offers a mix of short texts, graphics, videos, and interactive tutorials, along with access to a practice system to enhance your learning experience.

What's New?

Upon completion of the course and successfully passing the knowledge quiz, you will receive a badge that attests to your mastery of the course content. This badge serves as a valuable addition to your professional profile, highlighting your skills and understanding of SAP Central Business Configuration.

Badge receipt upon course completion

How to Manage and Showcase Your Badge

  • View your badge: Once you've completed the course and passed the quiz, you can view your badge under My Learning > Activity > Completed.
  • Add to LinkedIn profile: Optionally, you can add the badge to your LinkedIn profile to showcase your achievement to your professional network.
  • Share on LinkedIn feed: You can also share your accomplishment directly on your LinkedIn feed to let your connections know about your new skill.
  • Download as PDF: You can also download your badge as a PDF for easy sharing and record-keeping.

We believe that this badge will not only recognize your hard work and knowledge but also add significant value to your professional credentials. Don't miss out on this opportunity to stand out in your field.

Ready to Start?

Log on to SAP Learning and enroll in the Configuring SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with SAP Central Business Configuration course today.

If you liked this blog, please leave us a thumbs up at the top. Also, make sure to follow the SAP Central Business Configuration tag or follow this dedicated blog collection to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

entry.title: Re: ✨ Dubai SAP Community – Let’s Connect! ✨

entry.title: Re: How dunning process will work with purchasing value k...
entry.content:
Please check the below areas:

  • In the Output Parameter Determination app, ensure the Relevance Indicator is set to true for the output type (e.g., REMINDER or EXPEDITER). If this is false or missing, the system will skip triggering the output.
  • Confirm that the output type is active and assigned to the correct business application (e.g., Purchase Order). Check if the output type is correctly linked to the form template and communication channel (email, EDI, etc.).
  • Ensure the Purchasing Value Key is assigned to the material master and includes valid reminder days. The system only triggers output if the timeline condition is met (e.g., reminder days before delivery date).
  • Verify that the vendor master record includes a valid email address, Correct partner function (e.g., LF – Vendor) and Communication method aligned with the output channel.
  • The triggering document eg.Purchase Order must meet the conditions defined in the Output Parameter Determination decision table Document type, Purchasing organization, Plant & Vendor group, etc. Use the “Maintain Business Rules” section to review and test these conditions.
  • Use the Monitor Output Items app to check whether the output was triggered, if it failed, what the error message says. Status of the output (e.g., In Process, Error, Completed)
  • Finally, ensure the form template is assigned and activated. Check that the email channel is configured correctly in Output Management. If using email, confirm that SMTP settings are active and functional.

If you have checked all the above areas, then

  • Revisit the Output Parameter Determination app and validate each step.
  • Test with a Purchase Order that meets all conditions and includes a material with the Purchasing Value Key.
  • Use Monitor Output Items to trace the output status.
  • If needed, run a test output manually using the “Send Output” function in the PO document.

entry.title: Re: Production Process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Since disassembly is not natively supported in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, here’s a clean workaround

  • Step 1: Post a Goods Issue for R100 from inventory (movement type 551 or similar)
  • Step 2: Post a Goods Receipt for R01, R102, and R103 into inventory (movement type 501 or 561)
  • Assign a custom reason code like “Disassembly” to both movements for audit traceability. This approach is simple, auditable, and works well in a cloud environment where flexibility is limited.

entry.title: Re: Need Best Practices of ABAP Access to Production Envi...
entry.content:
Hi Farhan,

Adding to the other answers, I would suggest to discuss and review your security and authorization policies / operations / etc. with specialized consultants. Several SAP partner companies can provide those services to you and deep dive the multiple different aspects to be analyzed and managed. This is not something that can be easily managed by referring to a bunch SAP notes / documents.

In addition, with respect to the specific question, specific authorizations such as ABAP developer roles should not be granted in production to any user. In case you need to grant them, you should establish an emergency / privileged access management process (usually referred as firefighter). SAP provides specific solutions in the Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) portfolio that can support you structuring and automating this process. You can reach out to your local SAP referent for more information.

Hope it helps.

entry.title: Impact of Sales Order Delivery Date Change on Released Production Orders in S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Question:
I am working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud.

Scenario:

I have a sales order with a confirmed delivery date.

A production order has already been created, released, and production has started.

I also run the PP/DS optimizer as a nightly background job.

My question:
If I change the delivery date of the sales order, what will be the effect on the already released and started production order?

Will the system automatically reschedule the released production order?

How will this be handled in the nightly optimizer run?

Will I only see alerts/exception messages, or will there be any automatic changes to the order?

I would like to understand the expected system behavior and whether manual planner intervention is required in such cases.

entry.title: Re: Workflow for QM inspection plan on Goods receipt in p...
entry.content:
The SAP Help documentation referenced here explains how to define business rules for output parameter determination for inspection lots — primarily for printing sample-drawing instructions, inspection reports, and quality certificates. It does not address triggering workflows or notifications to users when inspection lots are created.

The recommended workaround in Public Cloud is

SAP’s Situation Handling is the best alternative in Public Cloud. You can:

  • Define a situation scenario for inspection lot creation
  • Configure it to trigger notifications to specific users or roles
  • Display alerts in the My Inbox or SAP Fiori Notification Center

This is the closest cloud-compliant alternative to classic workflow triggers.

What Output Management Covers in QM in the context of inspection lots, Output Management is primarily used to:

Print sample drawing instructions
Generate inspection reports
Send quality certificates
Distribute documents via email or other channels

This is configured using Output Parameter Determination, which allows you to define rules for when and how these outputs are triggered — based on inspection lot type, plant, material, etc.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Test Orchestration and Tester assignment using Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Hi Petra,

Thanks for your question. Dependencies between Test Case within a testplan are aleady available via Test Sequences which are currently optional.  

We plan* to have a setting per testplan that to make the sequence mandatory. Timeline not defined yet.

Sequence of Actions within a test case is also available and currently optional. 

If you have any requirements, feel free to use our Customer Influence portal to either vote for existing requests or to create new requests: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3501

Best Regards Reiner

BR0262I Enter database user name[/password]:
BR1334E Owner SAPSR3SHD already exists in database

Kindly guide to resolve this issue.

entry.title: Re: Impact of Sales Order Delivery Date Change on Release...
entry.content:
To your question, "what happens when you change the Delivery Date?", Once a production order is released, it becomes firmed in PP/DS. By default, released orders are not automatically rescheduled — even if the demand date changes. The system does not adjust the dates of released orders unless you manually reschedule them, or you configure the optimizer to allow changes to firmed orders. So the answer is No automatic rescheduling of released orders unless explicitly allowed.

The optimizer respects firmed or released orders and does not change them automatically. If the delivery date changes, the optimizer will generate alerts or exception messages (e.g., late delivery). Possibly suggest new planned orders to meet the updated demand. Leave the released production order unchanged, unless configured to allow changes. So, unless you've set up the optimizer to modify firmed orders, manual planner intervention is needed to reschedule or adjust the existing production order.

entry.title: Re: ECC EHP4 to EHP8 upgrade phase PREP_INSTALL/SUBMOD_PR...
entry.content:
Hello 

like mentioned in the sap notes you should check first if oracle vault ist active

sqlplus / as sysdba
SQL> SELECT VALUE FROM V$OPTION WHERE PARAMETER = 'Oracle Database Vault';

if the result of the query is "FALSE" you should delete this user in next step

sqlplus / as sysdba
SQL> drop user SAPSR3SHD cascade;

 other question is, why the user is already active in your db, like you can see in the error log (maybe old SUM run in the past?)

br

entry.title: Re: ABAP Dump when Opening SO
entry.content: You have not attached the screenshot. Also when asking about short dumps, please include as much information about the dump as possible. You can attach the entire dump as a ZIP file.

entry.title: Re: ABAP Dump when Opening SO
entry.content:
In a production (PRD) environment, direct table updates via SE16N or SE11 are strongly discouraged and often restricted for good reason. So please do not try this approach. Since you say, sale order is saved but when it is accessed, giving dump. So, you can try with the below workarounds

Engage your ABAP team to create a temporary correction program that validates the order, updates the quantity using proper BAPI or function module (e.g., BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE) and logs the changes for audit

If absolutely necessary and approved by governance, a controlled debug session in VA02 can be used to adjust the value.

Finally and as a important preventive measure,

  • add input validation in your API payload handler.
  • Use unit tests or mock payloads to simulate edge cases like this.
  • Consider implementing error handling and logging to catch anomalies before they hit SAP.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Intercompany Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
Hello Community.
This is my solution to a problem in IC_SALES:

When the material is not batch managed in the issuing plant (IP), but in the selling plant (SP), a batch will be created during GRTS (GR to Storage Location in SP). The material documents for the subsequent process steps GIFS (GI from Storage Location of SP) and GITC (Post GI from SiT to Customer) will be derived from the material document of the GIOD (GI for OD at IP into SiT) and will therefore not contain a batch number. The goods movement will fail.

My redefined method in ZCL_MMIM_VCM_ICS_01_ALL_STEPS (superclass CL_MMIM_VCM_ICS_01_ALL_STEPS) reads the batch number from GRTS and adds them to the material documents:

method prepare_sn_buffer_injection.
  call method super->prepare_sn_buffer_injection
    exporting
      matdoc_number = matdoc_number
      matdoc_year   = matdoc_year
      matdoc_line   = matdoc_line.

  case mo_context->meta_info-step_type.
    when 'GIFS' or 'GITC'.
    data: lv_mblnr type mseg-mblnr,
          lv_mjahr type mseg-mjahr,
          lv_zeile type mseg-zeile.

    select single guid from vcm_rt_step_ins into @DATA(lv_grts_guid)
      where step_type = 'GRTS'
        and value_chain_ins_guid = @MO_context->runtime_info-value_chain_guid.

    lv_zeile = ms_mb-ws_imseg-line_id+2(4).

    select single business_object_id from vcm_rt_bo_item into @DATA(lv_grts_boid)
      where step_ins_guid = @LV_grts_guid
        and business_object_item_id = @LV_zeile
        and business_object = 'MATERIAL_DOCUMENT'
        and deleted <> 'X'
        and cancelled <> 'X'.

    lv_mblnr = lv_grts_boid(10).
    lv_mjahr = lv_grts_boid+10(4).

    select single charg from mseg into @MS_mb-ws_imseg-charg
      where mblnr = @LV_mblnr
        and mjahr = @LV_mjahr
        and zeile = @LV_zeile
        and matnr = @MS_mb-ws_imseg-matnr
        and werks = @MS_mb-ws_imseg-werks.
  endcase.
endmethod.

I set my class in VCM_CHAIN_TYPE at process steps GIFS and GITC. It already runs in our production system. Feel free to use it or comment on it.

Best regards,
Martin

entry.title: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
In August 2025 we have published the updates to the technical guidelines for ABAP custom code development and governance in SAP S/4HANA private cloud and on-premise landscapes based on the evolution of the 3-tier extensibility model to the Clean Core Extensibility model following the newly established clean core level concept. See also the blog post ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update for the summary of major updates and the chapter 5 of the ABAP Extensibility Guide for more comprehensive information.

While summarizing the ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for the governance of clean core ABAP development this blog post describes also in detail the new ATC checks for clean core.

Technical ATC Setup

Set up a central ATC check system for governance of your ABAP custom code developments for clean core utilizing either ATC on SAP BTP or central ATC in private cloud (or on-premise) system.

ATC on SAP BTP: central ATC in the SAP BTP ABAP environment is the SAP recommended approach for governance of ABAP developments for clean core in SAP S/4HANA private cloud or on-premise landscapes. Meanwhile ATC on SAP BTP became a mature extensive solution providing such capabilities like custom code analysis (including SAP CVA security checks without separate licensing fee), scheduling of ATC runs, developer scenario, robust exemptions workflow, baseline and more. See also the blog post ATC on SAP BTP for on-premise developments for more information.

Set up a central ATC system connected against all development related systems (DEV, Q). Setup the ATC blocking mode in DEV systems for all Priority 1 and Priority 2 findings for transport tasks and transport requests.

Setup of ATC check variant for clean core

You should add the recommended ATC checks for clean core to your existing global standard ATC check variant. If you set up ATC for the first time you should create your own ATC standard variant as a copy of the default ATC variant ABAP_CLOUD_DEVELOPMENT_DEFAULT in ABAP development tools for Eclipse and add the clean core checks.

The recommended ATC checks for clean core:

✅  Allowed SAP enhancement technologies *
✅  Usage of APIs *
✅  Search for customer modifications
✅  Critical statements**

In addition, the following ATC checks are recommended to be added to your ATC check variant:

  • Code Vulnerability Analyzer (CVA)  (for security if CVA is licensed accordingly)

* See the next chapter for more details on these new ATC checks for clean core

** The Critical statements check must be parametrized in the check details:

with the following values:

Overview of the new clean core ATC checks

The new ATC checks for clean core are available in the ATC on SAP BTP in the SAP BTP ABAP environment. In the SAP S/4HANA 2023 private cloud and on-premise systems implement the SAP Note 3565942.

The Allowed Enhancement Technologies check reports usage of enhancements in custom code (object type ENHO) based on not allowed enhancement technology. The Usage of APIs check is based on usage guidelines for SAP APIs in custom code.

In the following we will focus mainly on the Usage of APIs check.

The ATC check “Usage of APIs” – How it works

What are classic APIs

SAP offers recommendations for release independent upgrade stable SAP APIs (classic APIs), which shall be used classic ABAP developments and provides the list of classic APIs  as objectClassifications_SAP.json on the GitHub - SAP/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc. This information is used by the ATC to govern the usage of classic APIs in custom code developments.

The classic APIs are based on the SAP recommendations for classic ABAP development technologies, reuse services and application specific frameworks, which should be utilized in classic ABAP developments (see the SAP Note 3578329 for more details).

Classifications are provided for the following SAP object types:

  • Function modules (FUNC)
  • Classes/interfaces (CLAS/INTF)
  • CDS views (STOB)
  • BO interfaces (BDEF)

Classic APIs can be inspected by the Cloudification Repository viewer on GitHub: https://sap.github.io/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc/?version=objectClassifications_SAP.json

Classic APIs offer access to application specific services like the well-known BAPIs and to the above-mentioned classic technologies and reuse services, for example central reuse classes from the SAP GUI programming:

Classic APIs classified as “transactional-consistent” can be used in the context of RAP-based applications (see also SAP Help Documentation about RAP Transactional Model).

There are also SAP objects classified as so called “no API”. These objects should not be used in custom code and replaced by SAP released APIs or classic APIs (if successor is available, it is listed in the object classification JSON file).

Check behavior

The purpose of the new ATC check Usage of APIs is to verify the usage of classic ABAP development objects based on the consumption of SAP APIs.

The check verifies usages of SAP standard objects in custom code like interfaces, classes, function modules, CDS views, behavior definitions, DDIC database tables and DDIC database views, programs or their subroutines, whereby the SAP DDIC object types like data elements, domains, table types and structures are not checked (no ATC finding is reported).

For usage of released SAP APIs in custom code no ATC findings are reported. For usage of an SAP classic APIs the check reports an info message, for usage of an API which is not classified (SAP internal API) the check reports a warning and for usage of an API marked as “no API” an error message containing successor is reported (if such successor has been provided). 

DDIC database tables, DDIC table views and programs are not considered as APIs, which means the following behavior is always reported: reading DDIC database tables or DDIC table views results in a warning, whereas modifying them results in an error.

Summarized the check behavior is as following:

Example

You can use the new ATC checks in the Analyze Custom Code app* (or Custom Code Migration app) on SAP BTP by including them into your custom ATC check variant in the SAP BTP ABAP environment and using this ATC check variant for analysis of your code in the private cloud or on-premise system. By filtering the findings you can target your analysis for example at an ATC check message. For instance, you can look how many findings and in which custom objects you get with the ATC check message “Updating DDIC database tables or DDIC table views is not allowed” to focus the adaptation efforts first on replacing SQL write accesses to SAP database tables with released CDS views. There are other useful filters in the app which can help to differentiate the ATC issues by the application components for example or by object name (e.g. to replace first the SQL write accesses in custom code to the specific table like VBAK).

* With SAP BTP ABAP environment 2508 the Custom Code Migration app was split up into two separate tiles. There is now the Analyze Custom Code app for the custom code analysis use case and the Custom Code Migration app for the migration to SAP S/4HANA use case.  See also SAP Help Documentation Custom Code Analysis.

If you take a look at the parameters of the Usage of APIs check in the ABAP development tools in Eclipse, you will see  that it takes as input the JSON file with classic SAP APIs objectClassifications_SAP.json:

NOTE: If your ABAP system does not have access to the internet, you can upload the file with the classic SAP APIs using the program SYCM_API_CLASSIFICATION_MANAGR and provide filename for the value of the classicAPIDataSource check parameter like this:

NOTE: If you want to consider classic APIs provided by SAP partners apply the SAP Note  3630552 Classic API Support in ATC Check "Usage of APIs" for Partners. This SAP Note enhances the Usage of APIs ATC check with the option to provide multiple classic API data sources. In addition, the program SYCM_API_CLASSIFICATION_MANAGR will give SAP partners the option to create new classic API JSON files with their own APIs.

You can also execute the clean core ATC checks over the custom code in your SAP S/4HANA system in ABAP development tools in Eclipse, where you can see the ATC findings according to different usages of SAP APIs in custom code.

For your convenience the detailed documentation of the Usage of APIs check is provided in the details of analysis results for each ATC issue.

For more detailed information about relation of clean core ATC findings to the clean core levels as well as  recommended actions how solve them refer to the chapter 5.1.2 in the ABAP Extensibility Guide.

How to control clean core development by ATC exemptions and baseline

If you have extension use cases, especially related to necessary changes in old legacy code, where you can not use classic APIs, you can work with ATC exemptions to control usage of SAP internal objects in your code. The ATC Exemption browser will monitor the ATC exemptions and provide the overview of the status of your system regarding to clean core development.

If you have a lot of legacy code in the system, and adjusting it to achieve a clean core is not considered reasonable from an ROI perspective you can create the initial ATC baseline for the clean core findings in this legacy code before starting with the new clean core development.

For more information please refer to the chapter 5.1.3 Clean core governance by using ATC exemptions in the ABAP Extensibility Guide.

Wrap up example

Here just one example to demonstrate how the ATC errors go down when using the new ATC clean core checks based on usage guidelines for SAP APIs instead of ABAP Cloud readiness checks based on usage of released APIs:

This multiple reduction of critical ATC issues in custom code is gained by the changes in the check procedure. The ABAP Language Version, ABAP Language Version of Objects and Allowed Object Types in Cloud Development checks are now excluded because the compliance with ABAP Cloud is not necessary for classic ABAP developments and the Usage of APIs check replaces the Usage of Released APIs check.

Try out the new ATC checks for clean core to reduce the number of  the ATC findings in your classic ABAP developments and focus your adaptation efforts on real technical debts.

entry.title: Re: Custom Tile Visualization & Navigation in SAP Build Workzone - Cloud foundry launchpad: Solv
entry.content:
HI @Kamakhya and @theodore_abitbol 

Thanks for the blog. I have facing some issues while creating the tile as Custom App Launcher. In Neo environment, there is a option to create the application as  "Custom App Launcher" tile Type. But in Cloud Foundry(SAP Build work zone) there is no option to create like that. But i need to create application Tile type as "Custom App Launcher". 

my requirement is, need to show the count in tile with 3 different color.

1) 0 - Green

2) 1 to 3 - Yellow

3) More than 3 - Red

So i have used GenericTile in my code. i want to create the application Tile Type as "Custom App Launcher". How to achieve this inn cloud foundry?. 

Please refer my below code.

View:

<GenericTile class="" header="Bank API Failures" press="press">
<TileContent footer="in Last 1 Hour">
<FeedContent value="{tileModel>/tileData/count}" valueColor="{ path: 'tileModel>/tileData/count', formatter: '.getTileColor'}"/>
</TileContent>
</GenericTile>

Controller:

 

onInit: function () {
			var that = this;
			setInterval(function () {
				var randomNumber = Math.floor(Math.random() * 11); // 0 to 10
				var oModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel({
					tileData: {
						count: randomNumber // dynamic count
					}
				});
				that.getView().setModel(oModel, "tileModel");
				// You can use the randomNumber here
			}, 1000); // 5000 ms = 5 seconds
 
		},
		getTileColor: function (count) {
			if (count === 0) {
				return "Good"; // red
			} else if (count < 3) {
				return "Critical"; // yellow/orange
			} else {
				return "Error"; // green
			}
		},

 Thanks 
Yogeshwaran S

entry.title: Re: how to set up scale on the Manage Purchasing Info Rec...
entry.content:
The Manage Purchasing Info Records app in SAP Fiori does not currently support scale maintenance (like quantity-based pricing scales) directly within its UI. This functionality is available in the Create Purchasing Info Record and Change Purchasing Info Record apps (typically accessed via SAP GUI or WebGUI tiles), but not in the Fiori-based Manage app.

Why it is because, the Manage app is designed primarily for viewing and basic editing, not full condition maintenance. SAP has confirmed here that scales are not supported in this app as of now

You have use SAP GUI ME11 which will allow full access to the Conditions tab, including scales.

If your organization relies heavily on the Fiori app, consider submitting a request via SAP's Customer Influence portal to enhance the Manage app with scale functionality.
